content.text: SNIPER: crypt - File & Folder Encryption Tool

text: A powerful, concurrent utility for encrypting and decrypting files and folders.
It uses the secure [bold]AES-256-GCM[/] algorithm and [bold]Scrypt[/] for key derivation
to provide strong protection against brute-force attacks.
[green]encrypt <path>[/]   Encrypt a specific file or all files in a directory recursively.
[green]decrypt <path>[/]   Decrypt a [cyan].enc[/] file or all [cyan].enc[/] files in a directory recursively.
[green]genpass[/]           Generate a strong, random password suitable for encryption.
[bold]Encrypt Options:[/b]
[green]-r, --remove[/]      [bold red]Securely delete[/] the original file(s) after successful encryption.
[bold]Genpass Options:[/b]
[green]-l, --length <N>[/]  Length of the password to generate (default: 24).
[bold]General Options:[/b]
[green]-h, --help[/]         Show this help message.
[#] Encrypt a single file and securely remove the original:
[yellow]sniper-crypt encrypt secrets.txt -r[/]
[#] Decrypt all encrypted files within a directory and its subdirectories:
[yellow]sniper-crypt decrypt ./my_archive/[/]
[#] Generate a strong 32-character password to use for encryption:
[yellow]sniper-crypt genpass -l 32[/]
â€¢ [bold]"Incorrect password or corrupted file":[/] The password is wrong, or the file was damaged.
â€¢ [bold]"Output file already exists":[/] The tool will not overwrite existing files during decryption to prevent data loss.
â€¢ [bold]Security Note:[/] Forgetting your password means your data is permanently lost. There is no recovery mechanism.
